info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 25 at 6:32PM EDT until June 25 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM EDT FOR WAYNE COUNTY... At 631 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Taylor, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Wyandotte and Greenfield Village around 640 PM EDT. Dearborn around 645 PM EDT. Downtown Detroit and Detroit around 650 PM EDT. Grosse Pointe around 700 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Melvindale, Gibraltar, New Boston, Rockwood, Harper Woods, Westland, Grosse Pointe Shores, Ecorse, Grosse Pointe Woods and Woodhaven. People attending Huntington Place , Trenton Summer Festival , Taylor Summer Festival , and Livonia Spree should seek safe shelter immediately! TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for southeastern Michigan. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
